column4: I just setup a RAID1 on my Intel RAID controller, and in the Ubuntu install it saw 2 disks...is that normal? Anyhow, I set it all up and it gave a GRUB boot error
thats fake raid, fakeraid is a terrible technology
fake raid has terrible linux support, hence seeing it as two disks
if your just using linux on those disks I suggest using linux software raid which is excellent
you have to use the alternative cd
or install to one disk in the normal cd and mirror it later
ok so i'll disconnect 1 drive, install ubuntu then plug back in 2nd drive and mirror it?
you don't need to disconnect a drive
just install it to one disk
